descriptions.Public Health (DPH): Administers a wide range of public health services and programs, including SF General and Laguna Honda hospitals.
descriptions.Asian Art Museum (AAM): City-owned museum showcasing art from Asian cultures.
descriptions.Arts Commission (ART): Develops public arts programming, gives grants and issues art vendor licenses.
descriptions.Fine Arts Museum (FAM): Oversees the De Young Museum and Legion of Honor.
descriptions.Public Library (LIB): Manages the city's main branch and neighborhood libraries.
descriptions.Law Library (LLB): Oversees the SF Law Library, a collection of legal resources for the public and legal community.
descriptions.Rec & Park Commission (REC): Oversees more than 220 public parks, playgrounds and open spaces.
descriptions.Academy of Sciences (SCI): Museum and research institute in Golden Gate Park.
descriptions.War Memorial (WAR): City-owned opera house and performing arts centers.
descriptions.City Administrator (ADM): Oversees a range of city services, such as the County Clerk, capital planning program, office of contract administration and others.
descriptions.Assessor/Recorder (ASR): Assesses and maintains records of all taxable property in San Francisco.
descriptions.Board of Supervisors (BOS): 11-member legislative body that sets city policy, and adopts ordinances and resolutions.
descriptions.City Attorney (CAT): Law office representing the City and County of San Francisco.
descriptions.Controller (CON): Chief budget office and auditor for San Francisco.
descriptions.Planning (CPC): Oversees long-range city planning, design review and environmental review for developments.
descriptions.Civil Service Commission (CSC): Oversees the city's merit system and sets policy for hiring and contracting.
descriptions.Technology (DT): Provides technology services to city departments and agencies.
descriptions.Ethics Commission (ETH): Promotes education and enforcement of governmental ethics laws.
descriptions.Human Resources (HRD): Hires, develops, and supports the city's workforce.
descriptions.Health Service System (HSS): Administers health benefits for employees and retirees of the city, SFUSD, City College of San Francisco and SF Superior Court.
descriptions.Mayor (MYR): San Francisco's chief executive. Sets policy, coordinates departments and intergovernmental activites, and prepares the budget.
descriptions.Elections (REG): Conducts elections and election-related services, and ensures voting access.
descriptions.Retirement System (RET): Administers pension and a compensation plans for current and retired city workers.
descriptions.Treasurer/Tax Collector (TTX): Banker, tax collector, collection agent and investment officer for the city.
descriptions.General/Unallocated (GEN): Responsibilities not directly attributable to one city department, or that are citywide in nature.
descriptions.Sheriff Accountability OIG (SDA): Civilian oversight body for the Sheriff's Department.
descriptions.Children & Families Commission (CFC): Develops and funds programming for young children and their families.
descriptions.Children, Youth & Families (CHF): Creates and facilitates citywide policy and projects in support of children, youth and families.
descriptions.Community Investment (CII): Redevelopment agency that coordinates financing, affordable housing, and design and land use approvals for new neighborhoods.
descriptions.Child Support Services (CSS): Establishes and enforces child and medical support orders.
descriptions.Environment (ENV): Sets and implements policy on waste reduction, renewable energy, nature conservation and other environmental goals.
descriptions.Homelessness Services (HOM): Oversees programs and contracts related to homelessness and supportive housing.
descriptions.Human Rights Commission (HRC): Enforces the cityâ€™s anti-discrimination laws and promotes community racial solidarity and healing.
descriptions.Human Services Agency (HSA): Provides food and cash assistance, health insurance, job training, early education and supportive care.
descriptions.Rent Arbitration Board (RNT): Conducts rent arbitrations and mediations, and investigates wrongful evictions.
descriptions.County Education Office (USD): San Francisco Unified School District, an independent entity.
descriptions.Status of Women (WOM): Promotes the advancement of women and girls through policies, legislation and programs.
descriptions.Adult Probation (ADP): Administers and coordinates reetnry programs, victims services and specialized court services for adult criminal offenders.
descriptions.Superior Court (CRT): State court with jurisdiction over the city and county of San Francisco.
descriptions.District Attorney (DAT): Prosecutes criminal violations of state and local laws.
descriptions.Emergency Management (DEM): Manages disaster and emergency response, including 911.
descriptions.Police Accountability (DPA): Investigates complaints about police officers and recommends policy changes.
descriptions.Fire Department (FIR): Provides firefighting, disaster response and emergency medial assistance.
descriptions.Juvenile Probation (JUV): Coordinates probation and rehabilitation services for youth offenders.
descriptions.Public Defender (PDR): Provides legal defense and services to criminal defendants.
descriptions.Police (POL): Enforces laws and investigates criminal activity.
descriptions.Sheriff (SHF): Manages jail and court services and provides other law enforcement support.
descriptions.Airport Commission (AIR): Oversees operations and maintenance of San Francisco International Airport.
descriptions.Board of Appeals (BOA): Hears and decides appeals related to permits, licenses and other use entitlements.
descriptions.Building Inspection (DBI): Approves plans and issues permits all construction in the city.
descriptions.Public Works (DPW): Maintains and improves civic buildings, streets and other public infrastructure.
descriptions.Economic & Workforce Development (ECN): Coordinates small business services, economic and neighborhood development, and job placement programs.
descriptions.Municipal Transporation (MTA): Manages Muni and transit infrastructure, including walking, bicycling, parking, driving, paratransit, and taxis.
descriptions.Port (PRT): Oversees operations and maintenance of the Port of San Francisco.
descriptions.Public Utilities (PUC): Provides water, power, and sewer services.
descriptions.Technology (COIT Funded): Funding allocated by the Committee on Information Technology, the city's tech governance and policy making body.
descriptions.Capital (CPC Funded): Funding allocated by the Capital Planning Committee, which makes recommendations on capital expenditures.
descriptions.Maintenance (CPC Funded): Funding allocated by the Capital Planning Committee, which makes recommendations on capital expenditures.
